summary: In 2008, Congress required the Department of Justice to create and implement a national strategy to combat the exploitation of children. The strategy must be updated every 2 years, led by an appointed senior official, and include 19 specific elements, such as setting measurable goals. But in the past 14 years, 9 detailees have rotated through the national coordinator position. DOJ has only issued a...
title: Online Exploitation of Children: Department of Justice Leadership and Updated National Strategy Needed to Address Challenges
